item.title: I’m 51, earn $129K and my 401(k) has $165K. Can I afford to retire when my husband, 59, draws Social Security at 62?
item.description: “He is retired from a state job and receives a pension that nets around $3,600 per month, as well as lifelong health insurance for both of us.”

item.title: Here’s why young investors are buying so much gold and crypto right now
item.description: Gold and crypto are two very different assets: The former is seen as a safe haven that tends to increase in value as other investments fall, while the...

item.title: ‘I’d do a much better job’: Trump blasts Powell as Fed expected to hold rates steady
Circle Internet’s stock-market surge continues as Senate bill’s passage indicates the federal government is taking stablecoins seriously
item.description: Less than two weeks after IPO, Circle Internet’s market capitalization surpasses nearly half of the S&P 500.

item.title: This solution to the high cost of healthcare could keep Medicare and Medicaid off the chopping block
item.description: Hospitals and outpatient clinics need to deliver their own spending cuts and cost savings.
